question.text: Sir William Bowman was an English surgeon. He discovered Bowman's capsule, Bowman's glands and Bowman's membrane. Bowman's capsule is found in the kidney. Where do we find Bowman's glands and Bowman's membrane?

options.text: Bowman's glands in eye and Bowman's membrane in nose
Bowman's glands in nose and Bowman's membrane in eye
Bowman's glands in nose and Bowman's membrane in tongue
Bowman's glands in tongue and Bowman's membrane in nose

solution.text: Bowman's glands are olfactory glands present in the nose. They are located just below the nasal epithelium and produce mucous to keep the olfactory epithelium moist. The cornea of the eye is made up of 5 layers: outer epithelium, anterior elastic lamina, substantia propria, posterior elastic lamina and inner epithelium. Outer part of the anterior elastic lamina, which is made up of collagen fibres, is called Bowman's membrane.
